metadata.title: CVE-2020-8112 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
opj_t1_clbl_decode_processor in openjp2/t1.c in OpenJPEG 2.3.1 through2020-01-28 has a heap-based buffer overflow in the qmfbid==1 case, adifferent issue than CVE-2020-6851.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-8112` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenjp2-7 - 2.3.0-2+deb10u2build0.18.04.1
libopenjp2-tools - 2.3.0-2+deb10u2build0.18.04.1
libopenjp3d-tools - 2.3.0-2+deb10u2build0.18.04.1
libopenjp3d7 - 2.3.0-2+deb10u2build0.18.04.1
libopenjpip-dec-server - 2.3.0-2+deb10u2build0.18.04.1
libopenjpip-server - 2.3.0-2+deb10u2build0.18.04.1
libopenjpip-viewer - 2.3.0-2+deb10u2build0.18.04.1
libopenjpip7 - 2.3.0-2+deb10u2build0.18.04.1
No subscription required

ghostscript - 9.26~dfsg+0-0ubuntu0.18.04.14
ghostscript-x - 9.26~dfsg+0-0ubuntu0.18.04.14
libgs9 - 9.26~dfsg+0-0ubuntu0.18.04.14
libgs9-common - 9.26~dfsg+0-0ubuntu0.18.04.14
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openjpeg2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.3.0-2+deb10u2build0.18.04.1').
insighttoolkit4 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
qtwebengine-opensource-src package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
blender package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
texmaker package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
ghostscript package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9.26~dfsg+0-0ubuntu0.18.04.14').
